title: Market report: Steer clear of sterling, warns Goldman
text:
Currency traders should beat a “tactical retreat” from sterling until the outcome of Britain’s Christmas election becomes clear, Goldman Sachs has advised.

The US investment bank’s analysts have recommended investors going “long” on the currency shift their positions, as the UK prepares to plunge into months of intense end-of-year campaigning that will almost certainly dictate the path of Brexit.

On current polling, the Conservatives would win a comfortable majority at the ballot on Dec 12, but memories of 2017’s turnaround campaign – in which Labour came from behind to rob Theresa May of the majority secured by David Cameron – are still fresh.
